Posts.Title: Tomorrow (tonight) is a bit tough....

Posts.Content: Welcome Nancy. Probably none of us(or few of us) are qualified to help with that decision. Do you trust your doctors? Why did you make the decision you did? Have you done some reseaarch on the web? I'm not saying you made the wrong decision, because I don't know anything about it...but you have to feel secure about the decsion you make. Like Jeanne has said, we are all here to support you and give you love and encouragement. Keep in touch.

Posts.Title: First Mom then Dad

Posts.Content: So sorry Mimi that you are feeling like this. I don't think it is unusual at all, but as you are well aware that doesn't mean you should not discuss it with your oncologist. I have never had trouble with depression or even feeling down..but there are mornings when I just don't want to start the day. I personally think chemo is the reason. I take industrial amounts of Vitamin D from my Diabetes doctor..butit has been shown that low vitamin D levels are very important to breast cancer. Many tests have also shown that men should be taking 1,000 units a day to ward off prostrate cancer,heart disease and depression..so maybe the larger amounts of vitamin D will help your feelings. I am thinking of you. I remember we started this trip about the same time and I have felt a little down lately..so maybe it's just another track along the road to being healthy.
Posts.Title: I'm having a hard time...
